episode_title: 416 - The One With The Fake Party

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Phoebe is stressing out about something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it hon?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I can’t find anything that I want to eat! Everything I eat makes me nauseous! I’m telling you, being pregnant is no piece of cake—ooh! Cake! (Chandler shrugs, and Phoebe grimaces.) No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, honey I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God! Ooh! What is that smell? It’s coming from the bathroom. Ooh! (She goes to the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Pregnancy does give you some weird cravings.
[Cut to the bathroom, Joey is taking a shower and Phoebe knocks on the door.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s me. It’s Phoebe. Listen there’s something in here I want to eat, what-what smells so good?
(Joey sticks his head out of the shower curtain.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is it the shampoo? It’s guava.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Wait-wait! (Reaches inside the shower.) Is it my bologna sandwich?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Yes. Yes. I can’t believe it! The baby wants bologna! Maybe he wants me to eat meat? I can’t eat meat!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, wait-wait! (Reaches into the shower again.) Maybe it’s a pickle?!
(Phoebe grimaces at the smell.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Joey and Rachel are there. Rachel is writing something on a pad, and then crumples it up and throws it on the floor.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you writing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Joshua’s coming in tomorrow and since I don’t have the guts to ask him out, I’m going to sell him a coat and put this note in the pocket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah? (He grabs the pad and starts reading it.) Joshua, give me a call sometime, guys like you (Pause) never go out of style—what did you throw away?
(Ross and Emily enter.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi guys!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what have you guys been up too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, we went to see a collection of Victorian doorknobs and the Cupert-Hewitt museum.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Without me?!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: My uncle dragged us there. But, it actually it turned out to be really interesting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: They were so ornate and beautiful, I mean look at that! (Shows them a doorknob she has.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know how museums work in England but, here, you’re not supposed to take stuff.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I uh, I got it from the gift shop. They have really lax security there. (Chandler is shocked.) It’s a joke. (They all laugh.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Right, I’ve got to be off, I’ll see ya. Buh-bye then. (She leaves.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! You guys seem to be having a good time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, she’s-she’s amazing. And-and she’s so much fun. And! Y’know what? When I’m with her, I’m fun! I even signed up for helicopter classes. (Chandler is shocked.) She’s leaving in two days, I don’t have to do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, two days, you must be bummed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, she’s got to go back to London. But you know what? I’ve been prepared for this from the start. We both knew we had two weeks together, and that’s it. Y’know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey that’s what all my relationships are like.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but in Ross’s case, they both know in two weeks that’s it.
(Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello! Hello!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! I know! I know! Yeah! So the baby is totally craving meat. This afternoon I tried tricking it, I made it a soy-burger to make it think it was getting meat, y’know? And I got nauseous.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe that’s because soy-burgers suck!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Being pregnant is tough on your tummy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, but at least you got that cool, pregnant lady glow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s sweat. You throw up all morning, you’ll have that glow too.

content.description: [Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is preparing to slip Joshua the note.]

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Okay!
content.parenthetical: coming in from a changing room

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, here’s that trench-coat that you wanted.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh great! (He tries on the coat.) Wow! Yeah, it’s comfortable.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Man, I could really flash somebody in this thing. (He goes to put his hands in his pockets.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no, no-no, they don’t want you to put your hands in the pockets until you are out of the store.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that’s because of a lot of…(She imitates someone picking their nose and placing the treasure found in the pockets.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Y’know, they ruin it for everybody.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Y’know, I wore that cashmere sweater on a date last night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, it was my first date since the uh, since the divorce.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, congratulations, so do you love her?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: No, no, no, she’s nice but, y’know, it just it made me realize that I’m just not, I’m just not ready to be dating, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. Well, uh, that’s uh, that’s interesting. (She goes over and retrieves her note.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hey-whoa-hey-hey, what was that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s just an anti-theft device.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Then uh, what’s-what’s this? (Shows her the real anti-theft device.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You need that, you need that too ‘cause obviously, a thief could just tear this up. (Rips up the note.)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is writing on the Magna-Doodle as Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oops, sorry. Listen, we-we have to have a party tonight! Actually, we have to have one in five minutes, so everybody cancel your plans.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what’ going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We have to have a surprise Bon Voyage party for Emily. But it’s actually for Joshua. (Starts handing out party hats.) Look, he said he’s not ready to date, so I had to invite him to a party if I wanted to see him outside of work, and now I have the perfect opportunity to seduce him! (Hands Ross a party hat.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, as much as I’d like to meet Josh and warn him, Emily and I aren’t going to be here. All right? I mean, she’s going to come by first to say good-bye, and then I’ve got a whole special evening planned. So I’m sorry, no party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Awwww!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Surprise!!!

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Surprise!!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: No one’s ever thrown me a surprise party before!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it was all Ross’s idea.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You’re so sweet! And I’m so surprised!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You really didn’t know?
[Cut to later, the party is in full swing. Rachel is in the kitchen and Chandler goes over to talk to her.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why are you in here if Joshua is all the way over there? (Points to the living room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, because I’m trying to play hard to get. Oh, quick he’s looking over here, say something funny.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Like what?
(Rachel laughs hysterically.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what-what is so funny?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I said, “Like what?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now that’s a thinker.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what, y’know what? This playing hard to get thing is not working. Umm, hand-hand me those cherries. (Chandler does so.) Okay. Okay. (She does a little sexy walk over to where Joshua is standing.) Hi!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Care for a cherry?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh, no thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No? Y’know, I can tie one of these into a knot using just my tongue.
(She tries to demonstrate this unique ability, but only succeeds in choking on it.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: You okay? (Rachel swallowed it whole and is not hacking like a heavy smoker in the morning.) You all right? (Rachel walks away, coughing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So we should probably get going soon.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, but the party’s only just getting started!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but we-we have to be at the Four Seasons for drinks in 15 minutes and then y’know, then The Plaza for dinner.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: So why did you plan a party at the same time?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, no, umm, actually American surprise parties are-are-are very short. It’s usually, “Surprise!” And then, “Oh my God, I’m so surprised—good-bye!”

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: But Ross, I’m such having a great time! Your sister has just been telling me that you used to dress up like little, old ladies and hold make-believe tea parties.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica said that did she? (He squeezes Monica’s knee really hardly and Monica winces in pain.)
[Cut to Joey and Phoebe in the kitchen. Phoebe is watching Joey make a sandwich.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, yeah. Then what are you going to put on top of that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A little salami.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh yeah! Then umm, what goes on top of the salami?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pastrami.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh, yeah. You’re a genius.
(Rachel enters, she has changed clothes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, could somebody give me a hand with this zipper?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. (He goes over to her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You changed?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I did. I needed my lucky dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And lucky means, more cleavage?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does for me.
(Joey starts wiping lint off of her back, but goes at little too far and Rachel just glares at him. He stops, gives her the ‘okay’ symbol and walks away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, God! Look at him, he’s so cute. I wanna go over there, grab him, and kiss him! How can I kiss him and not letting him know that I like him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! I know how you can get him, take off your bra.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There was a seen in Footloose …

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Flashdance .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, yeah, with that-that uh, plumber girl…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was a welder.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Were you like in the movie, or… Anyway, she takes off her bra under her shirt and pulls it out the sleeve. Very sexy, and classy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or if you want to kiss him, umm, you could use mistletoe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not Christmas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or Spin the Bottle?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s not 11!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Thank you so much for this. It was really so thoughtful of you.
content.parenthetical: with her coat on, she’s leaving with Ross

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? You’re leaving?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, we have something we have to get to.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Uhh, yeah, I think I’m going to take-off too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! You guys can’t leave yet! You have to stay, we-we got the whole big thing planned!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What big thing?
[Cut to later, the whole group is seated on the floor and Rachel is explaining the rules of Spin the Bottle.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, Spin the Bottle works like this: I spin the bottle, it lands on Gunther, so I would have to kiss Gunther. (She crawls over to where Gunther is sitting and sees the look of anticipation on Gunther’s face and decides not to kiss him.) All right. Who wants to go first?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I’ll go.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yay!
(Emily spins the bottle and it lands on Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Welcome to America. (They both kiss.)
(Joey spins the bottle and it lands on Emily.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two in a row! You’ve got to use your tongues now! (They kiss again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yay! Emily!
(Emily spins the bottle and once again, it lands on Joey.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are the odds? What are the odds?
(They both move to kiss again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that-that’s enough! Y’know, let’s, let’s let someone else play.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you didn’t want to play, why did you come to the party?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, my turn!!

(Rachel spins the bottle and it lands on…wait for it…Joshua. (You thought I was going to say Ross, didn’t you?) Rachel squeals in delight and starts a slow sexy crawl over to Joshua, making sure he and everyone else watching gets a good look at her cleavage.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!! The baby just kicked!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s okay! It’s okay! It kicked once, it’ll kick again!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh my God!
(They all stand up and go over to Phoebe to feel the baby, preventing Rachel from kissing Joshua.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, well, everybody just remember where they were sitting.
(She crawls over to Joshua and kisses the back of his knee. He feels it and looks down, Rachel pretends she’s knocking a bug off his leg.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just a bug.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, it is later in the party. The Spin the Bottle game is over and Chandler is making a sandwich as Phoebe watches.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know it doesn’t matter how much I’m craving it. Y’know why I’m never gonna eat meat? Because it’s murder, cold blooded murder.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(He takes a bite out of the sandwich and as he does so, Phoebe attacks the other end and starts devouring the sandwich.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s a Phoebe on my sandwich! (He walks away, giving the sandwich to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe, what-what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t help it. I need the meat. The baby needs the meat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right look, y’know how-y’know how when you’re dating someone and you don’t want to cheat on them, unless it’s with someone really hot?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, totally!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Okay. Well this is the same kind of deal. If you’re going to do something wrong, (He grabs two steaks from the freezer) do it right!
[Cut to later, Phoebe is finishing off her steak.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Feel better now?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but at what cost? Six more months, three meals a day, I’m gonna eat like, y’know millions of cows.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what if I said, I could even things out for ya, meatwise.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I eat a lot of meat right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, suppose until the baby’s born I laid off it. No extra animals would die, you-you’d just be eating my animals.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey, I can’t believe you would do that for me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Absolutely! I could be a vegetarian. There’s no meat in beer, right?
[Cut to Ross and Emily standing by the foosball table.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, we could still make dinner if we skipped the appetisers and asked for our check right away.
(Rachel enters, she has changed once again. This time into her high school cheerleading uniform.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: But, we can’t go now. It looks like Rachel’s gonna put on a skit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Have you lost your mind?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-n-n-n-no! I am finally thinking clearly. My lucky dress wasn’t working out to well for me, but for four years, this baby never missed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel-Rachel-Rachel I-I cannot, I can’t let—(pause), actually I kinda want to see what happens.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Nice uh, costume.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, yeah, well I wanted to give Emily a big American good -bye cheer. So okay! (Runs into the living room) Ready! Okay! Gimme an ‘E!’

content.speaker: All
content.text: E!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gimme an ‘M!’

content.speaker: All
content.text: M!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gimme an ‘I!’

content.speaker: All
content.text: I!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gimme an ‘L!’

content.speaker: All
content.text: L!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gimme a ‘Y!’

content.speaker: All
content.text: Y!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you get? (She throws her pom-poms to Joey and Phoebe and performs a cartwheel.) Emily!! (Tries to do another one.) Emil—Whoa!! (She falls in Chandler’s room.) Okay! So that’s me as a cheerleader! Ta-dum! (Gunther’s the only one that claps.)
(Joey and Monica rush over to her.)

content.speaker: Joey and Monica
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m fine! I’m fine! I’m just losing a tooth, it’s no big deal. I have a dentist! Y’know. I’m gonna go put some ice on it. Excuse me. (She goes over to the ice and Joey and Monica follow her.) What do I do now? What do I do now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think you’re done.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, time to take off the bra. (She glares at him.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Umm, that was really great, but I-I gotta take-off actually.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Take the bra off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, come on, let’s go get your coat.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Okay.
(They both go to Chandler’s bedroom to get his coat.)
[Cut to Gunther and Emily.]

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Rachel is my girlfriend.
[Cut to Chandler’s bedroom.]

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: So, this was uh, really fun.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah! Real fun. (She makes a decision.) Y’know, this bra… Really, bothers me. (She starts taking off her bra.) Y’know, this used to be my bedroom. Yeah. A lot of memories in here, a lot of memories. If these walls could talk, y’know what they’d say? Wanna hear some memories? (She is now violently pulling on her bra in order to remove it, but it isn’t co-operating.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Need uh, need a little hand there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no! No, I got this all under control.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: You really don’t seem like you do. That’s…
(She is still yanking on the bra, but it is stuck in her sleeve. Finally, she gives up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ughhhh!! Forget it! (Sits down heavily on the bed.) This is, this is not how this is supposed to happen.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Well, what was supposed to happen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Can you not look at me when I say this? (He turns around) I thought that if I could get you here, I could seduce you.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Huh. Oh, boy! (Sits down next to her.) Uhh, I-I don’t wear suits to work, and I bought six of them from you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’m sorry, I thought you needed them!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: No, no-no, no-no, my point is that I kept coming back because, I wanted to see you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Because I-I like you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You like me?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah! I mean you’re-you’re beautiful and smart and sophisticated—a lot of this isn’t based on tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but-but-but you liked me! Oh my God, I can’t believe this, all this time, I liked you and you liked me!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no don’t say but! No-no, but’s never good! Let’s just leave it at, you like me and I like you.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Okay uh, however…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, now see that’s a fancy but.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: My marriage like just ended, and I’m really not ready to get into anything yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I’m sorry, I, I just need a little time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.description: The hallway, Ross is sitting on the step drinking a beer as Rachel comes out of the guys apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, here you are. I was looking for you before. Joshua’s gone so you and Emily are free to go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay. She’s still in there enjoying her fake party and uh, it’s too late to do any of the things I had planned, so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross, I’m sorry. I completely ruined your evening.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I made a fool out of myself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Helps a little.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is there room on that step for a pathetic loser?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, have a seat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay, I mean it was just two-week thing anyway, I just didn’t want it to end this way, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe you didn’t want it to end?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You seem to really like her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I really do. Yeah, but what am I gonna do, I mean we-we both agreed that it was gonna be a two-week thing, y’know no commitment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, that girl just spent the entire evening talking to your friends, asking to hear stories about you, looking through Monica’s photo albums, I mean you don’t do that if you’re just in it for two weeks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you got like 14 hours until she has to be at the airport, and you’re sitting here in the hallway with a 28-year-old cheerleader with a fat lip.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you’re right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. (He starts to go inside and stops.) What photo album was it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, it was you and a bunch of albino kids.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Those weren’t albino kids, that was computer camp! Rach! (He hurries inside and Chandler is taking out the garbage.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re a pathetic loser, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho, yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sit!
(He does so, and immediately starts looking pathetic.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hi. (He has just returned.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my gosh, Joshua!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: All those things I said about not being ready…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They’re not true?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: No, they’re-they’re all true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Oh, I love that but.
(They move to kiss, but realise that Chandler is staring at them. Chandler urges them on.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You wanna go inside and have some coffee?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Joshua goes inside and to Chandler.) Every time.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, the next day. Phoebe is busy making a sandwich.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooh, what you got there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Pastrami.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho-ho, yeah! Hey! Y’know what goes good with that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hm-mm, corn beef.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, I was gonna say bologna, but that’s much better. How about a little of that smoked turkey?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh mama! Uh when-when is the baby due?
content.parenthetical: He starts looking longingly at the sandwich.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Six months.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ugh. Now if a cow should die of natural causes, I can have one of those right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not if I get there first.
